description.p: In the context of warfare, victory hinges on logistical prowess, high morale, discipline, and strategic acumen. Professional armies hold a distinct advantage over conscripted forces or scattered militias. Nobles often raise their own armies, and there exists a multitude of professional soldiers, including mercenaries. However, none can rival the esteemed legions of the Empire.

Imperial legions epitomize disciplined warfare, seamlessly executing military structure and employing advanced tactics. Officers undergo rigorous training to make sound decisions, maintain composure amidst chaos, and facilitate effective communication. A warrior imbued with such training is destined to serve as both guardian and leader, whether within the ranks of a legion or beyond.

When you choose this subclass at 3rd level, you have a calm and tactical presence on the battlefield. You read your foes as well as your allies. Although an adventuring party differs from an army, engagement tactics may still provide an edge. At the start of combat, you can swap the result of your initiative roll with an ally or an enemy that you can see. You and the target of this feature swap places on the turn orders for the entire fight. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Additionally, after 6th level, you and five other creatures you choose have advantage on initiative rolls.

sheet.description: At the start of combat, you can swap the result of your initiative roll with an ally or an enemy that you can see. After 6th level, you and five other creatures you choose have advantage on initiatives.

description.p: At 7th level, you can control your psychology at all times. You have advantage on saving throws you make against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, you have advantage on any skill check you make to free yourself from a grapple.
Additionally, if an effect moves you against your will, you can use your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 10 feet.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and you have advantage on any skill check you make to free yourself from a grapple. Additionally, if an effect moves you against your will, you can use your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 10 feet.

elements.element:
At 10th level, you are an example of courage and discipline for your comrades. Your mere presence gives them an edge against the enemy. You can use your indomitable feature using your reaction for an ally within 60 feet of you that you can see. That creature can reroll the saving throw that they failed. If they do so, they must use the new roll.
Additionally, when you use your Indomitable feature on yourself or an ally, you will lose the usage of the Indomitable feature only if the new result is a success. If the new result is a failure too, you keep your usage of indomitable feature.

description.p: Starting from 15th level, you are the embodiment of defiance. Nothing is over until you say so. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to take 1d6-1(minimum 1) levels of exhaustion and drop to 1 hit point instead.
You can use this feature as many times as you want, but remember stacking exhaustion levels to 10, will lead to instant death.

sheet.description: When you reduced to 0 hp, you can use this feature as many times as you want but you will take 1d6-1(minimum 1) levels of exhaustion and drop to 1 hit point instead. Stacking exhaustion levels to 10, will lead to instant death.

description.p: At 18th level, you are relentless on the battlefield. Whenever an enemy forces you to make a saving throw against an effect and you succeed the roll, you will gain hit points equal to your fighter level instantly.
Additionally, If you use your Cohort Discipline feature on an ally and they succeed their saving throw, that ally will gain hit points equal to your fighter level instantly as well.

sheet.description: When you succeed a saving throw, you regain hit points equal to your fighter level. Also, thanks to your Cohort Discipline feature, allies can also benefit from this heal when they succeed a saving throw with Cohort Discipline.
